title: Arlene Foster
summary: Arlene Isabel Foster (n√©e Kelly; born 17 July 1970)[1] is a Northern Irish[2] broadcaster and former politician who served as First Minister of Northern Ireland from 2016 to 2017 and from 2020 to 2021 and as Leader of the Democratic Unionist Party (DUP) from 2015 to 2021. She was the first woman to hold either position. Foster was a Member of the Legislative Assembly (MLA) for Fermanagh and South Tyrone from 2003 to 2021.
